title: Boy, 15, charged with murder in drive-by shooting death
content:
KANSAS CITY, Kan. —
A 15-year-old boy has been charged with first-degree murder in Friday’s drive-by shooting that killed Brannae' Browne.
The Wyandotte County district attorney announced the charges against Michael Adams Jr. Wednesday afternoon, hours before a planned vigil to honor Browne.
Browne was on the front porch outside a friend’s home when someone fired shots from a passing car. She died of her wounds. A second person was also injured.
Police said Adams’ mother, Natasha Hays, was killed in a drive-by shooting three days earlier at 2417 N. Ninth St.
Prosecutors also charged Adams with criminal discharge of a firearm at an occupied dwelling and criminal use of a weapon. Police said the criminal use of a weapon happened when Adams and police came into contact during the Hays investigation.
